title: BBC Local Live: Updates for Norfolk on Tuesday, 1 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: hundreds of hospital appointments are cancelled , despite a strike by junior doctors being cancelled .
breckland councillors to vote on plans to stop people smoking near playgrounds and schools .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it from the norfolk live team on tuesday , but we 'll be here from 08:00 tomorrow with news , travel , sport and weather updates throughout the day .
do n't forget to let us know of anything happening in your part of that county that you 'd like to share .
you can contact us onfacebookor send anemail , or viatwitter .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the headlines : primary school pupils 'below national average ' launch of christmas drink-drive campaign
text: the latest headlines from norfolk live :
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: weather : cloudy and dry
text: it will be a cloudy and dry night , with localised hill fog .
temperatures falling to 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow will be dry , with bright spells .
temperatures reaching 12c ( 54f ) .
there 's more information on the bbc weather website
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: marham 's tornadoes could assist in syria campaign
text: defence secretary michael fallon has told mps that if parliament approves military action in syria , more raf planes will be deployed to the region .
eight tornado gr4s , based at raf marham , are currently stationed at raf akrotiri on cyprus .

mr fallon would n't confirm exactly which resources would be deployed in the event of parliament 's approval , but i understand the plan could including flying more tornadoes from raf marham to the region .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: new home for arthritic penguin
text: a homeless arthritic penguin is moving to a new `` des res '' in norfolk later this week .
dippy the humbolt penguin and 10 of his feathered friends will take up residence at the great yarmouth sea life centre , following the closure of their home on the isle of wight .
the centre is equipped with a penguin-pool access ramp ideally suited to meet dippy 's special needs .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: county council 'working towards a good school for every pupil '
text: norfolk county council says it will continue to work with school leaders and education partners , to achieve the best for the county 's schoolchildren .
thelatest ofsted report says the county 's primary school pupils are below the national average in reading , writing and maths .
of the secondary schools in the county , 67 % are judged `` good '' or `` outstanding '' , compared to 79 % in the rest of the country .

james joyce , chairman of the children 's services committee , said : `` we know that working together , schools , governors and crucially parents all have a vital part to play in achieving our shared goal of a good school for every norfolk learner . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: police road safety officer has 'no sympathy ' for drink drivers
text: norfolk police says that anyone caught drink-driving can expect to lose their licence , which could lead to a person losing their job , home or even their family .
as its annual drink-driving campaign gets under way , pc chris tremling says he has no sympathy for drink-drivers .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: norfolk senior cup tie postponed
text: tonight 's scheduled norfolk senior cup last 16 tie between wroxham and great yarmouth town is off , as the pitch is waterlogged .
the teams will try to play the tie next tuesday .
elsewhere , gorleston host fakenham in the same competition , while lewis thompson is in caretaker charge of downham town for their match at king 's lynn reserves .
in thurlow nunn one , thetford are at mildenhall and swaffham host kirkley and pakefield .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: rare chance to explore cathedral at night
text: there 's a chance to see norwich cathedral in a different way to usual tonight .
more than 100 jam jars holding candles will illuminate the cloisters , giving people a rare opportunity to explore the cathedral after dark .
the dean of norwich , jane hedges , will also be joining 40 others spending the night sleeping in the cathedral grounds for an advent sleepout - raising awareness of the church urban fund .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: king 's lynn stars re-sign robert lambert
text: the king 's lynn stars speedway team have confirmed that teenage sensation robert lambert will ride for the club next season .
the 17-year-old from foulsham has been at the elite league stars for two seasons .
he will also ride for newcastle in the premier league and masarna in the swedish elite league .
watching him on the bike gives me goosebumps , he never looks in trouble , he always looks safe and confident .
i just think he 's brilliant .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: leaflet 'worst example of written tripe '
text: the plain english campaign has announced the results of its 2015 awards , with the golden bull given `` for the worst example of written tripe '' .
the recipient of this is nhs east coast community healthcare , for a leaflet detailing the role of a community specialist nurse for neurology .
in a statement , a spokesperson for the organisation said the leaflet was replaced in april with a more patient-friendly version .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: travel : disruption to rail services
text: greater anglia warns of disruption to rail services until 17:00 on the main line between norwich and london .
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: 'much more to be done ' says ofsted 's regional director
text: strong leadership and good teaching are the `` fundamental ingredients of a really good school '' , according to andrew cook , the regional director for ofsted in the east .
he was speaking after the school inspectorate 's annual report on education standards in the county .
norfolk is among the lowest 25 % of all local authorities across england for primary school pupils , with seven to 11-year-olds below the national average for reading , writing and maths .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: state of the art kitchen for school
text: a primary school in thorpe st andrew is getting a new £ 1.6m hall and kitchen .
the old mobile dining room at hillside avenue primary and nursery school is being replaced by a modern kitchen and dining hall , giving the 460 pupils more room .
we 've got 15 classes , from nursery to year 6 , and they need the hall space for pe , drama and dance lessons . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: two hundred year old carpet replacement 'complicated '
text: a new library carpet is being laid at the national trust 's felbrigg hall today , replacing the original that has been there for nearly 200 years .
david luckham , of the living looms project , which made the replica carpet , said he had not been involved in a similar job in his 40-year career .
he told bbc radio norfolk 's matthew gudgin it was `` a very complicated job '' .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: travel : a11 closed northbound
text: the a11 london road in eccles road is closed northbound , with slow traffic at the shropham turn-off .
a vehicle carrying straw and manure has overturned .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: plans for new homes in west norfolk
text: controversial plans for 130 new homes in the marsh lane area of king 's lynn and gaywood look set to be approved tonight .
campaigners say the plans are flawed and have voiced concerns about a proposed road through the estate , fearing it will create a rat run .
but planning officers say the scheme is well located to the rest of the town , and designed to cut down on car journeys .
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: voluntary ban on smoking approved by councillors
text: breckland councillors have approved a plan to try and stop people smoking near schools and playgrounds , although it can only be a voluntary ban .
the pro-choice group forest , says the idea is heavy-handed .
smoking in the open air does n't harm anybody 's health whatsoever to try to claim they are endangering people 's health is shame-faced , it 's quite outrageous to make that suggestion . ''

documents.title: the headlines this lunchtime : primary school pupils 'below the national average ' hospital appointments cancelled across the county
text: the stories making the news this lunchtime :
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: two-hundred-year-old carpet replaced
text: a new library carpet is being laid at felbrigg hall today , replacing the original which had seen nearly 200 years of use .
it was n't possible for the national trust to have the original carpet repaired , as its yarn had been dyed with the pattern before being woven .
analysis revealed it was made up of 30 colours in a 3ft floral design , so the pattern was traced and the colours carefully matched , before being woven in strips and sewn in one piece .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: concerns about state of primary education in the county
text: strong leadership and good teaching are the `` fundamental ingredients of a really good school '' , says andrew cook , the east 's regional director for ofsted .
he was speaking after the school inspectorate 's annual report on education standards in the county .
norfolk is among the lowest 25 % of all local authorities across england for primary school pupils , with seven to 11-year-olds below the national average for reading , writing and maths .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: mp to vote against syria air strikes
text: the labour mp for norwich south , clive lewis , has said he 'll be voting against the prime minister 's plans to take military action against the so-called islamic state in syria .
mps from across the uk will vote tomorrow on whether military action should be extended .
mr lewis , a close ally of labour leader jeremy corbyn , warns that if the war `` extends with no ends '' , the party would be looking at who voted in favour of action .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: primary school pupils ' progress 'below national level '
text: ofsted says progress made by pupils at primary schools in norfolk is poorer than in other parts of the country .
the schools inspectorate 's annual report says seven to 11-year-olds in the county are below the national level for reading , writing and maths .
secondary schools do n't fare much better .
ofsted says that only 67 % of them are judged to be rated `` good '' or `` outstanding '' .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: high number of patients puts hospital on black alert
text: the norfolk and norwich hospital remains on `` black alert '' today , after a high number of patients last night put pressure on its services .
the hospital says it 's working with the ambulance trust , clinical commissioning groups and neighbouring hospitals to clear the backlog .
the james paget hospital in great yarmouth says it 's `` busy '' but is not on black alert , which is when a hospital 's services are overwhelmed by demand .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: brave kaiden , 2 , lights up everyone 's day
text: the front page of today'slynn news .
author: Lynn News

documents.title: norwich christian centre launches £ 25k appeal
text: the revelation christian resource centre is appealing for £ 25,000 to ensure it can continue to provide books and materials to the christian community .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: robert lambert to ride for swedish team
text: norfolk speedway sensation robert lambert will ride for a swedish team in 2016 .
the 17-year old from foulsham has agreed a deal to join masarna , a team just promoted to the swedish top flight .
lambert will also be part of newcastle 's premier league team next year , with king 's lynn stars yet to announce their elite league line-up .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: crackdown on drink-drivers
text: motorists who drive after drinking or taking drugs are being targeted by norfolk police , during its annual christmas drink-drive campaign .
last december more than 2,400 drivers were breathalysed , with 79 people giving positive readings .
we 're not hiding up trying to catch people or spoil anyone 's christmas .
we 're trying to make sure they enjoy the holiday without having to visit people in hospital or having lost someone . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: loza scores five for canaries under-21s
text: norwich city striker jamar loza scored five goals at carrow road last night , as the canaries under-21 side beat southampton 7-2 .
it was 4-1 at half-time , with loza and midfielder cameron king getting two goals each .
the jamaican international then scored in the 82nd , 86th and 89th minutes to complete his five-goal haul .
city captain russell martin , midfielder vadis odjidja and striker kyle lafferty all started the game .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: queueing for hours to get in a & e
text: the front page of today 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: council hopes to stop people smoking near playgrounds
text: a voluntary ban on smoking near schools and playgrounds is being considered by councillors in breckland today .
the idea is to prevent children coming into contact with second hand smoke .
the council says it would be a voluntary ban , as they ca n't force people not to smoke in these areas .
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: hospital appointments cancelled across the county
text: strike action by junior doctors planned for today was suspended last night , but that decision came too late for hundreds of people in norfolk whose hospital appointments have been cancelled .
just under 400 appointments at the norfolk and norwich hospital have been called off , along with 11 operations .
the james paget hospital in great yarmouth says some operations and out-clinics have been affected .
all planned operations and appointments at the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn will go ahead , but four out patient clinics have been cancelled .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: weather : dry and cloudy
text: mostly dry and cloudy , but breezy in coastal areas - with temperatures reaching 12c ( 54f ) .
tonight will be dry and cloudy , with a few outbreaks of rain .
remaining mild and breezy .
temperatures falling to 10c ( 50f ) .
you can find further information on bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: the early headlines : hundreds of hospital appointments cancelled christmas drink-driving campaign begins
text: the stories making the news in norfolk this morning :
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: welcome to norfolk live
text: hallo and thank you for joining us for tuesday 's norfolk live page , where we 'll bring you the news , sport , travel and weather updates from now until 18:00 .
we also love to hear what 's happening in your part of the county , so send us a tweet , or get in contact via facebook or email .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Norfolk Live
